cards.html:
Good morning, {first_name, "lovely subscriber"},

Welcome to the very first edition of Morning Conference — the morning newsletter for subscribers of One Man & His Blog. I had this idea late last year, but unfortunately, the closure of schools put pay to my plans to launch in January.

Here's the idea: this is a short, sharp morning email, to help you catch up on the media and publishing related news that might be useful to you in your work. I'll give you a little context on each story, and let you decide if it's relevant.

In a way, I'm giving you a glimpse into my “notebook”, at the sort of information I'm using to inform my training and consulting work.

Feedback, as ever, gratefully received.

sections: Substack and newsletters become a big thing, so clearly the Zuckercopier has been fired up to clone the product. Facebook has provided
on its forthcoming newsletter/creator monetisation offering.

While I can see why Facebook is doing this, and why it might seem like an attractive idea to do this from some creators' point of view, the idea of the whole — or even a substantial chunk — of my income being dependent on Facebook's good will brings me out in hives.
I see no sign here that Facebook will make it easy to move your subscribers, and their billing details, if you ever moved platform. Risky.
From $0 to $140,000 newsletter revenue in a year
Talking of newsletter revenue, bloody hell, look at this:
Geekout was launched in June 2020 (nine months ago). It’s now on track to generate $140,000 in sponsorship and ad revenue in its first year.
There's two people working on it. That's a pretty lucrative side-hustle. Interesting that the revenue is ad-based: looks like social media managers are a spendy market to target.
Once again, we see that social media — and Facebook in particular — can allow a small group of people to have an outsize impact on public discourse.
OK, this is a bit of a cheeky one. This is a piece by me, for my long term client NEXT Conference. It thinks through some possible implications for targeted advertising from the next big iOS update.
